* Reads the next line of user input from the command-line interface.
* @return the raw input string entered by the user

* @param error the error message to display
* Prints a farewell message and a separator line to indicate
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints a confirmation message when a task is added,
* displays the task, and shows the updated task count.
* @param toBeAdded the task that was just added
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
* Prints the current number of tasks in the list,
* handling singular and plural forms correctly.
System.out.println("Now you have " + this.tasks.size() + " task in the list.");
System.out.println("Now you have " + this.tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a confirmation message when a task is removed,
* displays the removed task, and shows the updated task count.
* @param toBeDeleted the task that was just deleted
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + toBeDeleted);
* Prints a message indicating that the task is
* marked as completed, followed by a separator line.
System.out.println("This task has already been marked as completed");
* Prints a message indicating that the task
* is not yet marked as completed, followed by a separator line.
System.out.println("This task has not been marked as completed");
* Prints a confirmation message when a task is marked as complete,
* displays the task, and surrounds the message with separator lines.
* @param toBeMarked the task that was marked as complete
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Prints a confirmation message when a task is marked as incomplete,
* displays the task, and surrounds the message with separator lines.
* @param toBeMarked the task that was marked as incomplete
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Represents the exit command in the Atlas application.
* When executed, it signals the program to terminate.
* Does nothing on execution since only termination is needed.
* @param taskList the current list of tasks (unused)
* @param atlasCLI the CLI for user interaction (unused)
* Indicates that this command should terminate the program.
* @return {@code true} always, since this is the exit command
* Represents an executable command in the Atlas application.
* Subclasses define specific actions and their execution logic.
* Executes the command using the given task list, CLI, and storage.
* @param taskList   the current list of tasks
* @param atlasCLI   the CLI for user interaction
* @param atlasStorage the storage handler for saving/loading tasks
* Indicates whether this command will terminate the program.
* By default returns {@code false}; subclasses override if needed.
* @return {@code true} if the command should exit, {@code false} otherwise
* Represents a command that marks a task as complete.
* If the task is already complete, shows a warning instead.
* Marks the task at the given index as complete and saves the updated task list.
* If the task is already complete, prints a warning message instead.
* @param taskList the current list of tasks
* @param atlasCLI the CLI for user interaction
* @param atlasStorage the storage handler for saving tasks
public void execute(AtlasTaskList taskList, AtlasCli atlasCLI, AtlasStorage atlasStorage) {
* Represents a command that adds a deadline task to the task list.

* @param atlasStorage the storage handler for saving tasks

* @param atlasCLI the CLI for user interaction
* @param atlasStorage the storage handler for saving tasks
public void execute(AtlasTaskList taskList, AtlasCli atlasCLI, AtlasStorage atlasStorage) {

* Converts raw user input into executable commands,
* maps text tokens to actions, and parses date-time strings.

* Parses a string into a {@link LocalDateTime} using the format d/M/yyyy HHmm.

* Converts a command token into an {@link Actions} enum value.
* @param token the raw command string entered by the user
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the token does not match any action

* @param command the raw user input string
* @return the constructed {@link Command} matching the user input
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the command is invalid or missing arguments
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if an index argument is out of range
public static Command parse(String command) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalArgumentException {
